keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.CORE

Class Chromosome

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.CORE.Chromosome
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Chromosome
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

    This class represents the chromosome (rule) of the CORE algorithm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Chromosome()
      Default constructor.
      Chromosome(Chromosome c)
      Deep-copy constructor.

      Evaluates an input example (array of doubles as extracted from KEEL API)

      int getNumGenes()
      Gets the number of genes of this chromosome
      boolean isEvaluated()
      Gets the evaluation status
      void mutate()
      Applies a mutation on this chromosome, adding a gene (0.5 prob) or deleting one gene (0.5 prob or if this chromosome has genes for all the attributes)

      Applies a random mutation of the specified gene

      Remove a specific gene from the chromosome, using the Object.equals() method (must be the SAME object with SAME id)

      Deletes one gene from the chromosome

      Reset the count of captured tokens for this rule in the tokens competition

      Test if two chromosomes are equals by comparing their values

    • Method Detail

      • addNominalGene

        public void addNominalGene(int pos,
                           Attribute a,
                           int relation,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)

        Adds a nominal gene to this chromosome (rule)

        Parameters:
        pos - Position in which we put the gene
        a - the attribute related to this gene (nominal!)
        relation - the type of the relation which implements the gene (see Gene.java)
        values - the nominal values that covers this gene

      • addRealGene

        public void addRealGene(int pos,
                        Attribute a,
                        int relation,
                        double value)

        Adds a real valued gene

        Parameters:
        pos - Position in which we put the gene
        a - the attribute related to this gene (real or integer!)
        relation - the type of the relation which implements the gene (see Gene.java)
        value - the real values that covers this gene

      • addRealBoundedGene

        public void addRealBoundedGene(int pos,
                               Attribute a,
                               int relation,
                               double[] value)

        Adds a real-valued gene, and sets its bounds

        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the gene in the chromosome
        a - the attribute related to this gene (real!)
        relation - the type of relation (see Gene.java)
        value - array of 2 positions, with the minimum bound (position [0]) and maximum bound (position [1])

      • removeGene

        public void removeGene(int index)

        Deletes one gene from the chromosome

        Parameters:
        index - position of the gene to be deleted

      • removeGene

        public void removeGene(Gene gene)

        Remove a specific gene from the chromosome, using the Object.equals() method (must be the SAME object with SAME id)

        Parameters:
        gene - gene object to be deleted from the chromosome

      • evaluate

        public int evaluate(double[] input)

        Evaluates an input example (array of doubles as extracted from KEEL API)

        Parameters:
        input - the input instance
        Returns:
        the class of this rule if covered, -1 otherwise

        Parameters:
        gen - index of the gene to be mutated

      • mutate

        public void mutate()

        Applies a mutation on this chromosome, adding a gene (0.5 prob) or deleting one gene (0.5 prob or if this chromosome has genes for all the attributes)

        Set this chromosome as evaluated (fitness computed for the current set of genes) or not

        Parameters:

      • isEvaluated

        public boolean isEvaluated()

        Gets the evaluation status

        Returns:
        True if the fitness is correct for this gene set, false otherwise
